抵.definition: to press against; to support; to prop up; to resist; to equal; to balance; to make up for; to mortgage; to arrive at; to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)

抵住.definition: to resist; to press against; to brace

抵債.definition: to repay a debt in kind or by labor

抵償.definition: to compensate; to make good (a financial loss)

抵充.definition: to use in payment; to compensate

抵制.definition: to resist; to boycott; to refuse (to cooperate); to reject; resistance; refusal

抵押.definition: to provide (an asset) as security for a loan; to put up collateral

抵押品.definition: security (property held against a loan); mortgaged property

抵押貸款危機.pinyin: di3 ya1 dai4 kuan3 wei1 ji1

抵拒.definition: to resist; to stand up to

抵擋.definition: to resist; to hold back; to stop; to ward off; to withstand

抵消.definition: to counteract; to cancel out; to offset

抵減.definition: to claim a credit against; tax reduction

抵牾.definition: to conflict with; to contradict; contradiction

抵用.definition: to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility); to use in lieu; to redeem (a coupon etc); to use to offset (an amount owed etc)

抵用金.definition: store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)

抵罪.definition: to be punished for a crime

抵補.definition: to compensate for; to make good

抵賬.definition: to repay a debt in kind or by labor

抵賴.definition: to refuse to admit (what one has done); to disavow; to renege

抵足而眠.definition: lit. to live and sleep together (idiom); fig. a close friendship

抵足而臥.definition: lit. to live and sleep together (idiom); fig. a close friendship
